dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very emphatic) I don't believe you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as regards Andy's house, I'd have no need to break into Andy's house, because I own Andy's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care whose house you own, you're nothing but a slimy, mean-                      * minded little hood!

dialogues.speaker: ON ANDY
dialogues.text: Partially dressed, stepping into the doorway and combing her hair as she addresses Joan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please stop interfering in my personal life, Joanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red lifts the beeper to his mouth again:

dialogues.speaker: RED ANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go ahead.                           I just want to go out PARK (V.O.)                 little color back, for Red? I've got good news.            god sakes... We've found one for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, you know something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she moves over to Andy, Red gets up, paces around with the beeper and his and Parks' VOICES are MUFFLED in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind of woman you are is a danger to the kind of woman I am, so the next time you and your boyfriend have a domestic spat, don't call me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if you're going to take this kind of grumpy attitude, I certainly won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as she goes back into the bathroom, Joan turns to Harry:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, where are my clothes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up and Red steps INTO FRAME beside him, a distressed look on his face as he listens to Park (V.O.):

dialogues.speaker: HARRY PARK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think they must be              I'm over at Poly- outside.                          Medical. How soon can you get over here?

dialogues.speaker: JOAN
dialogues.text: Will you go get them                      RED (V.O.) please, I'd like to leave.        Wait a minute, don't rush me on this, Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry moves around Red and steps up to Joan:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY PARK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Can I just talk to you for        I'm not rushing you, one minute first?                 but we don't have the luxury of waiting too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOAN                      long either. There's nothing for you to say, Harry, it's very clear               RED (V.O.) what your priorities are.         Well, I want a hell of a lot more information

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY                     before you start Honey, all I've been trying       carving me up. to do, from day one, is look out for you...                       PARK (V.O.) (pauses)                     I can tell you this Don't you believe that?           much, Red, I've taken a look at it and I'm very excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you people be quiet, I can't hear this. (to the beeper) Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan and Harry are forced to listen to the following exchange:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as sound a muscular bag as I've ever seen and the pericordium is a gorgeous color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/22/91                             10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well whose heart is it?   Give me a profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any specific data, but the host was around 35 and she was obviously very healthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godammit, Monroe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins pacing anxiously again, the CAMERA FOLLOWING him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I don't want a woman's heart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it's not going to change you in any way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?!   You don't know that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, let's just get it done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Red paces toward the open bathroom door, Harry and Joa resume their discord:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY PARK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In other words, you don't         And later if you find trust me.                         you're unsatisfied with it, we can always get you another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you please get me my clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moncrief steps in beside Joan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell you a moment ago, that I was privileged to see you at the Bowl on the Fourth of July...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what.   I'm talking to this lady...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/23/91                             10

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Andy pauses in her application of mascara, shifting her gaze to Red's reflection in the mirror as he enters behind her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't tell me what kind of a woman she was?! And if she was so godammed healthy, why is she dead?!

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: ON Moncrief, Joan and Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was especially moved by your rendition of 'The Battle Hymn of The...' Harry suddenly grabs Moncrief roughly by the arm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind that shit.   Tell her... He shakes him, causing him to spill his iced tea onto the front of his jacket:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I spend your money! Did I give you any services for it. Tell this woman the truth, you son of a bitch! Harry releases him and under the following, Moncrief takes out a handkerchief and dabs at his jacket:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shall we start with the fact that you're a married man... (looking at Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then go on from there?

dialogues.speaker: ON JOAN'S REACTION
dialogues.text: Devastated, as she looks at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the above)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! What are you trying to do to me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/22/91                            110

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She turns away from him and goes toward the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she disappears inside, Red re-enters, and covering the speaker vents on the beeper, strides over to Moncrief:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know whose heart this body- snatcher is trying to give me?! A victim of somebody called the Westside Slasher! And this is the doctor you recommended to me! (into the beeper) You're killing me, Monroe! You know that?! You're pushing me to the goddamned wall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan comes out of the bathroom with the doctor's jacket and moves immediately to the hallway door and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan moves quickly down the hall, putting the doctor's jacket on over her hospital smock, with Harry following, trying desperately to explain:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey,   there's a simple explanation to all   of this, if you want me to go into   it... I was trying to tell you at   dinner... She disappears into an intersecting hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you just stop for one minute and let me talk to you... It's very complicated... He disappears into the same hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red, slumped in a chair and looking in desperation to Andy, who enters, now fully dressed and looking as glamorous as a movie star:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the hell should I do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/22/91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming over to him) Well Red, better a woman than dead, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches down and proprietarily brushes the scarf from his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's just go there, sweetheart, and have him sew the darn thing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan sits in dejected silence, refusing to look at Harry:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you know, you live a life, honey, you make some mistakes. You get married for maybe mutual benefits, or business considerations weighing on you at the time, and because you don't think the right person is ever going to come along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never have knowingly become involved with a married man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that, that's why I was trying to come out and tell you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I don't want to discuss it anymore. (after a brief silence) I bet you never read Dante, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there you're 75 percent wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I can't believe it, that you'd lie to me about this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I lied. Didn't you ever tell a lie? If not let me kiss your high heel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/22/91                              1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Can I call you tomorrow, just to see how you're feeling? Or how things are going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a dress rehearsal tomorrow and a concert on Friday. That's all I care about right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches to the door handle, then very emotionally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't want to see you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that, please. I'm asking you to just give me the chance to clear up all these things in my life, because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I didn't extricate myself from the infidelities of one man, just to fall into the arms of the prince of prevaricators...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I may be all kinds of a son of a bitch, and the prince of whatever, but that doesn't mean I wouldn't, when it comes down to it, stand up and take the bullet for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finally looks over at him, her eyes brimming with tears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I observed, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Joan crosses the driveway to the house, moves up the steps to the front door and disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: He remains seated for a moment, glancing briefly down at the watch on his wrist. Then his eyes raise expectantly as:

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: comes out the door and lopes across the driveway toward the Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry lays a hand on Duke's head, half-heartedly acknow- ledging the dog's devoted greeting, then he moves with him toward the van. On his way, he glances somberly over his shoulder at the house. In so doing his gaze falls on the ax embedded in the hood of the Mercedes. He stops and walks back to the car. Once again, he takes hold of the ax handle and makes several attempts to dislodge it. In a final Arthurian effort, the blade yields and he pulls the ax free. He suddenly steps back away from the car, as a steamy spray of hot radiator water spurts up from the gash in the top of the hood. Then he glances guiltily toward the house, and moves to his van with Duke following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, his suitcase and clothes in the front seat and Duke in bed of the van, parks in front of the House of Bliss:

dialogues.speaker: FOR LEASE SIGN
dialogues.text: in the plate glass window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry knocks on the door of the apartment, waits for a response and getting none, steps over to one of the windows and looks inside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, I want my dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around to see his ex-partner, Lee MacGreevy standing on the pathway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/22/91                             11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Lee, how are you. (moves toward him) I just this minute got back from Vegas. I was dealing a couple of dogs to Paul Anka. (shakes his hand) I was about to give you a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't embarrass us both, man. Just give me the dog back, and let's preserve the friendship.

dialogues.speaker: ON HARRY AND LEE
dialogues.text: as they move over to Lee's van:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, I'm in the neighborhood of getting my hands on the money. I'm about to close a business deal with Vark Zulethian of Zulethian Carpets, you've probably heard of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I know these dodges backwards and forwards. I need the dog. He's up for a TV series.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop beside the van. Harry glances at the printing on the side panel: Lee MacGreevy - Trainer of "Duke," - The World's Smartest Dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the above) I don't even want the ten thousand now, compared to what he might appreciate to.

dialogues.speaker: ON HARRY
dialogues.text: as Lee opens his van and takes out a leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, our agreement was I could buy the dog back. He's  the only thing I got to prove to people what I can do, and all I'm asking you, Lee, is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/22/91                            115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me have to get legal with you, Harry. You sold me the animal, then as a personal favor, I let you borrow him, to demo to some V.I.P.. that probably don't even exist. You haven't been straight with me, man. (hands him the leash) Just go get the dog.

dialogues.speaker: ON DUKE AND HARRY
dialogues.text: as they come across the parking lot to Lee's van.    Harr hands him the leash and Lee addresses Duke:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ignores the command and looks at Harry:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke, geh im wagen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke jumps into the back of the van. Inside is a large wire travel kennel with another German shepherd inside. Lee removes the leash from Duke and gestures at the other dog:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you take this dog, Harry. He's green, but maybe you could do something with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the cage and clips the leash to the dog's collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't want the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shepherd jumps out to the ground, wagging his tail:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving him the leash) Go ahead, man. Take him. If you don't want him, pick up some change. (closing the van) Sell him for a pet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lee starts to walk past him, Harry detains him, indi- cating the words on the side panel of the van:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/22/91                             11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me one favor, will you? Say 'owner' if you want to, but don't say 'trainer.' I trained that dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (claps him on the shoulder) Let me think about that, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves past him and OUT OF FRAME. Harry, watching Lee's van pull away. In the rear window Duke's face can be seen, looking back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, in a profound state of bereavement, as Vita fills a coffee cup in front of him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without responding, he looks across to the House of Bliss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the Meatloaf Special?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at her, unable to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken pot pie?... Tuna melt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finally answers, but from some place deeply felt and unrelated to the day's specials:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: equally bereaved, in front of a full-length mirror, while a seamstress makes some adjustments on her gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/23/91                             11

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In the b.g., members of the Chorale can be seen milling about and conversing at the close of the dress rehearsal. Helen, now free of her crutches and holding a gown over h arm, moves INTO VIEW, addressing her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of us are going to grab a bite. You want to join us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, go ahead.    I'm not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who's going to drive you home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddy steps INTO FRAME:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, because I don't want you to be alone. Alright? (blows her a kiss) See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves away and Joan returns her attention to the mirror, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Eddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stands in the vicinity of the fountains. His attention on the facade of the Chandler Pavilion, where: A contingent of the Chorale can be seen exiting out through the glass doors in various groupings.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Searching for Joan. Following the last grouping, Joan, carrying a garment bag, and Eddy Revere, exit and move in the direction of the other Chorale members, crossing the Plaza to the stairway leading down to the surface parking lots. MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/23/91                             11

dialogues.speaker: ON HARRY
dialogues.text: as he restrains the impulse to follow, then does so.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: &

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Eddy's Jeep as it moves through one of the seedier sections of the city. Joan stares sadly out the window. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate living here now. (a pause)                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to move to a small town, where it's friendly, and everybody knows each other, and there are no bars on the windows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the milkman's a child molester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Eddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's true. It doesn't matter where you live. Shit happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in a bad mood or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not in a bad mood.   Not as bad as yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, he begins softly singing the words to a popular song.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 111

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van moves through the same city streets as above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/23/91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sports car is in between the van and Eddy's Jeep. From the higher vantage point of the van, he has a clear view through the rear window of Eddy's Jeep and just before it makes a right-hand turn onto a northbound street, Joan can be seen leaning over to Eddy, placing her face close to his.

dialogues.speaker: ON HARRY'S REACTION
dialogues.text: Stunned and disturbed by the implications of what he's seen.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CITY STREETS/INT. EDDY'S JEEP NIGHT
dialogues.text: Joan, singing the same song as above, her head inclined toward Eddy's, harmonizing her voice with his as the Jeep turns onto a street leading up into the Hollywood Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further up the winding road a car passes him, obscuring his view of Eddy's Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddy and Joan are now midway above the city. They drive in silence for a while, then he begins what seems to be a casual reminiscence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when we were on tour in Japan, in '86?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night after we did a concert in Osaka?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you be more specific?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/23/91                          120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a few drinks in your room.                   * And a certain intimacy took place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She appears uncertain that she shares the same memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when I asked to see you the next                * night, you know what you said? You                  * were too tired and sleepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was witty of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you weren't. Because an hour later, you went into Lewie's room and you didn't come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you remember, I was in love with Lewis around that time, which I confided to you, so you did know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Eddy, you just passed the turn off to my street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to drive a little, so                   * we can talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs impatiently, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway,  if I remember correctly,                   * we only  kissed. But if that led you to  believe something that hurt you in  any way, I apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches up to adjust the rearview mirror, inadver- tently drawing her atttention to his hand. MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/23/91                            121

dialogues.speaker: FLESHY CRADLE
dialogues.text: between the thumb and the forefinger is imprinted with a crescent-shaped series of indentations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like somebody bit you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He returns his hand to the steering wheel. She looks at him, with a slight smile, waiting for him to elaborate, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, am I supposed to guess, or are you going to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She breaks off, suddenly aware that the teeth marks are her own:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Eddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep   pulls off Mulholland and onto a dirt road, lifting   a haze of dust into the car's headlights, appea ing and   disappearing in the switchbacks, Harry's van ca be seen,   following.

dialogues.speaker: JEEP
dialogues.text: The Jeep continues on the winding road, nearing a promontory high above the city.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 120

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Van tries to negotiate without the benefit of four- wheel drive, up a steep and rutty incline. MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/23/91                            122

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The van bounces and skids. The green shepherd in the bed of the van pants nervously, looking at Harry struggling with the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep pitches about on its shocks as it moves up an incline graded slightly higher than the one already giving Harry trouble. Eddy shifts into four-wheel. Joan, jostled about by the uneven surface beneath them, looks over at him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you deserved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't deserve it. I've always thought of you and treated you as one of my closest and dearest friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I use to think very highly of you, too, but now I don't like what I see. In fact, it's been very disturbing to me, Joan. (pauses, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very disillusioning. To see that before you've even gotten rid of Lewie, you've started up with some other man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddy, I want you to take me home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheels of the van loose traction. Harry gets out and looks up toward the taillights of Eddy's Jeep, disap- pearing in the hazy distance. He looks for a rock and finding one large enough, wedges it under one of the rear tires. Then he quickly gets back into the van.

dialogues.speaker: ON WHEEL OF VAN
dialogues.text: spinning to no effect and sending up a jet of dust. MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/23/91                           123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep pulls onto a large dirt promontory situated above the city and makes a sharp angle, bringing it to the edge of the brush and chaparral sloping down into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddy and Joan. Under the following, his hand reaches down to something lying out of sight to the left of the driver's seat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, there's so  many things about me you have no  idea of. You never ask me about my  life or what I'm thinking, because  you have no interest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do. You can tell me whatever you want to, but let's go back down to... She breaks off as she catches sight of a knife held in his left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creative things, and dreams, and feelings I have, that Lewie or anyone else in your life, are not capable of... She suddenly reaches frantically to the door handle and tries to get out. He grabs hold of her arm and pulls her back into the seat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? You're not genuinely interested. You're not at all sincere, Joan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You present yourself like you are, but you're not... (moves his face closer to hers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think I know that, better than anybody? He takes her arm and places it around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/23/91                            124

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to listen to me, and I                      * want you to kiss me. And this time, like you mean it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings his mouth close to hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver's door suddenly opens and Harry, in the heat and fury of his jealousy, instantly begins berating her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what is this! What the hell are you doing with this guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches in and pulls Eddy away from Joan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warning is simultaneous with an attempt by Eddy to stab him with the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Eddy's arm and in hauling him out of the car, rips loose the sleeve of Eddy's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Eddy and Harry, the latter finding himself engaged in a violent scuffle with a man larger than himself and possessed of the prodigious strength of the psychotic. Joan hurries around   the car. Harry, his cheek cut, is trying to force the   knife out of Eddy's hand. She looks toward Harry's van,   parked several yards behind Eddy's car and immediately   runs over to it.

dialogues.speaker: ON VAN
dialogues.text: She pulls open the door and addressing the dog inside, points toward Harry and Eddy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke, fasse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/23/91                          124A.

dialogues.speaker: 123A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The shepherd jumps out of the car, runs past her to the nearest bush and lifts his leg on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs back to the two men and hurls herself at them, causing all three of them to land in the brush on an incline at the side of road.

dialogues.speaker: 123A CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A frantic free-for-all takes place on the precarious footing of the hillside, with Joan alternately pulling at one and pushing at the other. The intensity and violence of their struggle is such that she is knocked further down the incline. Harry, quickly glances down the hill to see if she is alright and is left open to severe blow by Eddy, who breaks free and runs to his car. Harry pursues him, catching him as he tries to get into the car. He pushes him against the door and they begin battering each other with a series of punches. The SHEPHERD, wanting to join in the excitement, leaps about them, BARKING joyously. Then finding Eddy's sleeve, he takes it in his mouth and begins shaking it vigorously. Joan, her hair fretted   with twigs, climbs up over the edge of the hill. In    the b.g. behind her, a HELICOPTER APPROACHES. She looks    toward Harry and Eddy trading blows, then climbs up   the rest of the way, and as she gets to her feet, she   picks up a stone and throws it at them, yelling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastards!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The search beam of the COPTER spotlights Joan. She is bent over, picking up sticks and stones and as if routing a deadly enemy, she begins hurling them, as well as a series of invectives, at the lights of the city below, her words barely audible over the sound of the ROTORS. The beam sweeps from her, to pick up Harry and Eddy and an AMPLIFIED, God-like voice comes from above:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) What are you people doing down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joan turns back to Harry. He holds the now unconscious Eddy by his shirt front and resuming his accusations, starts to move toward Joan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?! What are you doing, running around with a guy like this!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises her arm, ready to hurl the last stone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You maniacs!!    You liars!!   You shits!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you yelling at me for?! This son of a bitch is probably the Westside Slasher!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the circling HELICOPTER: A man, holding onto a life- less body, seems to be stalking toward a woman in a defensive stance, standing on the edge of the hill with a stone in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a domestic quarrel. Let's get a car up here quick.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HARRY AND JOAN
dialogues.text: She is yelling at him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm finished wagging my tail and leaving little puddles on the floor...!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And smiling on command, because I don't give a damn whether any of you like me or not!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) Are you alright, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling up at the copter) Yeah, she's alright!! I've got him!! (gesturing at Eddy) The Westside Slasher, I got him!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not the Westside Slasher!!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE JOAN
dialogues.text: (from above)                 He's a friend of mine!! Just stand where you are, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend of yours! This guy's a friend of yours?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of you are friends of mine, you fucker!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) Ma'am, is this guy bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both yell up into the blinding light of the search beam:

dialogues.speaker: JOAN HARRY
dialogues.text: Will you shut up!!                  I'm not bothering her Harry lets go of Eddy and leans down to pick up the knife, gesturing it at the helicopter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you assholes! The guy was holding a knife at her throat!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) Okay, put the knife down, fellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then to Joan again, taking a step toward her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing, kissing this guy!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't kissing him!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) Stand where you are, and put down the knife.

dialogues.speaker: ON JOAN
dialogues.text: Perceiving the danger to Harry:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the knife down, Harry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN TROUBLE - Rev. 4/22/91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the copter) Why don't you go harass someone else!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) We've got a bead on you, so just put it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified that they are going to shoot him, she moves over to Harry:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) Stay where you are, don't go near him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the copter) I just saved her life, you son of bitches!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the knife out of his hand, throws it away, then places her arms around him, desperately pantomiming to the helicopter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? He's not hurting me! He's my friend!! (then, to Harry) This is just for their benefit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) Don't touch her, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's what I am, honey, your friend, that's what I wanted to tell you, and then I saw you with this guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) Don't worry, lady, we've got a car on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (up into the light) Will you please shut up and go away!! This is private! Can't you see that!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to tell you, because you don't know, how important you are to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from above) Step away from him, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waves the voice off, trying to listen to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I   needed you to know this one other   thing about me, because I don't   want to withhold anything from   you anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I don't want to know, Harry. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My real name's not Harry.    It's Eugene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (profoundly relieved) Oh. (saying it lovingly) 'Eugene.' I love that name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene puts his arms around her. The "ET RESSUREXIT" from Bach's B-Minor Mass BEGINS OVER the sound of the ROTORS. The CAMERA MOVES TO a REMOTE ANGLE, REVEALING them bathed in a celestial cone of light from above, making intimately emotional declarations and explanations to one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: conducting the full chorus, soloists and orchestra in the above music.

dialogues.speaker: ON AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: The CAMERA SEARCHES OUT some familiar faces and FINDS Socorro and her son-in-law, Balto. In the row behind them, Detective Melveny, and a few seats to the side of him, Vita, the waitress.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANDY
dialogues.text: restively fanning herself with a programme, seated in an aisle seat next to Moncrief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER: Lee MacGreevy opens the enclosure, puts Duke inside and MOVES OUT OF FRAME. Duke paces unhappily back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER: Shadows from a barred window are cast onto the wall behind Butch Gable and Eddy Revere, who sit sulky and disinterested in the MFCC's cheerful Therapy Hour Rap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER: Duke makes a run from the far end of enclosure and vaults into the air, sailing over the top of the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER: Red Layls lies with a plastic tube up his nose. His hospital gown is open and his chest area is laced up like a football. Through half-closed eyes he watches the cardiograph line hooked up to his heart, dance in tempo to the MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER: Duke, looking like he "knows what he's doing and where he's going," runs through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dressed in leather, on the back of a motorcycle, her arms around the helmeted young man, moving in a counter- direction to Duke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER: Adele in her shorts and halter top, attends the barbecue, a spatula in her hand. As though someone had just addressed her by her rightful name, she suddenly turns to look IN the CAMERA, and happy to be noticed, she lays the spatula down and begins to do a hula dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER:   Duke, running through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER: Sturge leans with his back against the Continental. Across from him is Eugene's van, and in through the window the green shepherd looks back at him with one of Eugene's socks dangling from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER:   Duke, running across an intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER: Sturge lights a cigarette, then raises his eyes to see: Duke, leaping up onto the hood of Eugene's van. He lies down and lowers his head to rest on his paws. Then look- ing across at Sturge, he raises his lips in a soundless, disdainful growl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Singing.   Her eye catches: Eugene, arriving late. He moves    down the aisle searchi for a seat. He has forgotten to    remove the training leash from his belt loop and the   tip of it hangs an inc or so below the hem of his sport   jacket.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Finding an empty seat, he edges in past a couple on the aisle and seats himself.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHORUS
dialogues.text: Soloists and orchestra.

dialogues.speaker: ON EUGENE
dialogues.text: Listening.

dialogues.speaker: ON JOAN
dialogues.text: searching for him again and finding him, she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ON EUGENE
dialogues.text: He returns her smile. His eyes shine and glisten with emotion and an expression of undissembled and openly childlike delight takes shape upon his face. CREDITS FINISH.   The SCREEN GOES BLACK.   The MUSIC CONCLUDES.
